node.title: Fund manager calls out 'greenwashing' in investment sector
node.description: A fund manager is calling out what it calls the growing issue of greenwashing in the investment sector.

node.title: Australia election: Enter a lacklustre advert for democracy
node.description: Analysis - The BBC's Nick Bryant sees an Australian election campaign that will be defined, to a large part, by what it lacks. Video

node.title: Britney Spears announces she is pregnant
node.description: "I am having a baby!" the pop star announced Monday.

node.title: Ukrainian girl taken into U.S. border custody moved to shelter
node.description: The vast majority of the unaccompanied children in U.S. care hail from Central America, but officials have recently received a small but growing number of Ukrainian minors.

node.title: Ukraine economy to shrink 45% because of war, World Bank says
node.description: "The magnitude of the humanitarian crisis unleashed by the war is staggering," World Bank official said.

node.title: Democratic Senate candidate to appeal decision to keep her off ballot
node.description: Some of Finkenauer's signatures on petition to qualify for ballot were successfully challenged by Republicans.

node.title: 'Not welcome' - Wellington residents fed up with Miramar protest
node.description: A Wellington city councillor fears a group occupying a bay on Miramar Peninsula could cause an ecological crisis and wants them to go home.

node.title: Ministry of Health announces third death linked to vaccine
node.description: New Zealand has recorded its third death considered to be linked to the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccination.

node.title: Macron to face Le Pen in second round of French presidential election
node.description: The challenge for Macron now is to unite the left and center-left behind him for the second-round runoff.

node.title: Biden's sister says Trump "intent" on bringing her brother down
node.description: She writes about her relationship with her brother — as well as her concerns about his 2020 presidential run — in her new memoir.

node.title: What is a ghost gun?
node.description: These untraceable firearms can be made at home with no background check or serial numbers, and officials say they're contributing to a rise in gun violence.

node.title: Biden announces new rule on "ghost guns" aimed at preventing gun crimes
node.description: "If you commit a crime with a ghost gun, expect federal prosecution," President Biden said.

node.title: Philadelphia revives mask mandate as COVID-19 cases surge
node.description: Health commissioner says residents will again need to cover their faces inside public spaces.

node.title: Taxes 2022: Here's how to ask the IRS for an extension
node.description: As of April 1, some 70 million Americans had yet to file their returns. Here's what to do if you need more time.

node.title: Watch: Andris Apse - A life through the lens of landscape, loss and Latvia
node.description: Andris Apse is one of New Zealand's greatest landscape photographers, yet his own story reminds us life can sometimes match the beauty and strangeness of our finest art. Frank Film has his story. Video

node.title: Steady Scheffler wins Masters
node.description: World number one Scottie Scheffler held rock steady and cruised to a three-shot victory at the Masters.

node.title: 'Something needs to be done' - Call for changes after cyclist deaths
node.description: A grieving mother says Auckland Transport needs to do more to keep cyclists safe after two deaths in the past two months.

node.title: Mimi Reinhard, who typed up Schindler's list, dies at age 107
node.description: She was one of 1,200 Jews saved by the German businessman after he bribed Nazi authorities to let him keep them as workers in his factories.

node.title: Kmart prepares to close its 4th remaining store
node.description: The former retail giant cemented a place in American culture with its Blue Light Specials, Jaclyn Smith Collection and offerings on nearly everything.

node.title: How to watch tonight's CMT Music Awards
node.description: For the first time, the CMT Music Awards is airing on CBS.

node.title: Stacey Abrams-backed election lawsuit heads to trial
node.description: Stacey Abrams is a gubernatorial candidate in Georgia once again as the lawsuit plays out in court.

node.title: Russian journalist who protested war named contributor for German station
node.description: Marina Ovsyannikova interrupted a live broadcast on a Russian state channel last month with a sign that said: "Stop the war. Don't believe propaganda. You are being lied to."

node.title: Liz Cheney sets personal fundraising record ahead of August primary
node.description: Cheney brought in $2.94 million in the first three months of 2022.

node.title: Woman found guilty of helping MS-13 lure 4 men to their deaths in N.Y.
node.description: Escobar allegedly lured the men to a park to smoke marijuana; the victims were attacked by gang members with machetes, prosecutors said.

node.title: As mom of 14 faces execution, Texas governor pressured to stop it
node.description: Melissa Lucio, a mother of 14, who convicted in the death of her two-year-old daughter; her lawyers say it was a tragic accident.

node.title: Watching for new COVID variants in wildlife "now critical," CDC says
node.description: The agency recently reversed recommendations against routine surveillance of the virus in wildlife, as officials huddle to strategize over the potential threat.

node.title: Model who allegedly stabbed man to death "acted in self-defense"
node.description: The family of a man who was allegedly stabbed to death by an Instagram model in an expensive Florida condo wants her arrested.

node.title: Georgia coroner finds bodies of his own parents and son at gun range
node.description: Thomas and Evelyn Hawk had operated the gun range for three decades, and their grandson Luke was helping out at the shop on his spring break.

node.title: Some Jan. 6 defendants turn to trial by judge instead of jury
node.description: A review by CBS News shows more than a dozen Jan. 6 defendants have unsuccessfully tried to move their trials out of the nation's capital.

node.title: After defeats, Russia taps general with grim history to lead Ukraine war
node.description: General Alexander Dvornikov, whose brutal tactics against Syrian rebels led to war crimes accusations, is now in charge of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
